title.narrative: Hands Off II Sex work INERELA+

description.narrative: Hands Off II partners work to reduce violence against sex workers at community, national and regional level. Outcomes of INERELA+ mainly involves a more enabling and supportive environment for sex work.

Religious leaders are in a unique position to create a more supportive environment for sex work. Under Hands Off INERELA+ looks to empower its members (religious leaders of their interfaith network) to become agents of change who will help eliminate stigma and discrimination within their congregations and communities, and challenge stigma against sex workers. To this end INERELA+ will develop a training curriculum on sex work in collaboration and consultation with its members and in-country sex worker communities.

Sex workers experience violence from members of their community, relatives or peers. Violence is often fuelled by a context of stigma and discrimination. Within this context, sex workers are looked down upon socially and denied access to many formal and informal societal structures. In most Southern Africa contexts religious leaders vocally oppose to sex work, stressing that it's harmful and morally repugnant, reinforcing stigma and violence.

The programme’s primary target group is female, male and transgender sex workers, meaning those who receive money or goods in exchange for sexual services, either regularly or occasionally. INERELA+ will work with its members, religious leaders, and will work with influential people from their congregation and community.

mailing-address.narrative: Aidsfonds - Soa Aids Nederland, Condensatorweg 54, 1014 AX Amsterdam

description.narrative: Policies and laws are supportive of the wellbeing of sex workers

title.narrative: Number of national/regional/global level groups and committees in which sex workers are represented

description.narrative: Number of national/regional/global level groups and committees in which sex workers are represented

comment.narrative: The figure zero is a total of all numbers added up for INERELA+ Zambia, Botswana, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Mozabique. On the ground so far there is no national, regional or global level group or committee in which sex workers are represented.
The figure is a total of numbers added up for INERELA+ Zambia, Botswana, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Mozabique

description.narrative: Stigma and discrimination against sex workers is reduced

title.narrative: Number of community leaders trained on the rights of sex workers

description.narrative: Number of community leaders trained on the rights of sex workers

comment.narrative: The figure zero is a total of numbers added up for INERELA+ Zambia, Botswana, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Mozabique. No community or religious leader has been trained so far on the rights of sex workers. Through Hands Off they we are going to train religious and community leaders on the rights of socal workers
The figure (1400) is a total of numbers of community and religious added up for INERELA+ Zambia ( 500), Botswana (150), South Africa (300), Zimbabwe (250) and Mozabique (200)
Training manual development not yet completed.

title.narrative: Sex workers report a reduction in experienced stigma and discrimination by their community and by society

description.narrative: To identify a change in communities and society’s perspective on sex work contributing to a more supportive environment for sex work. This indicator refers to stigma and discrimination in relation to sex workers HIV status and/or gender/sexuality/profession and includes self-stigma.
